"What's in this image?"
"Review this code for bugs"
"Analyze this data and find trends"
"Translate this document to Spanish"

Supported File Types: - Documents: PDF, TXT, DOC, DOCX - Images: JPG, PNG, GIF, WebP - Code: All programming languages - Data: CSV, Excel, JSON

docs.title: Temporary Chat Mode
docs.text:
Private Conversations:

To Enable: 1. Click More Options (⋯) 2. Look for temporary chat notice or setting 3. Start a new chat in temporary mode

Temporary Chat Features: - Conversations not saved to history - Content may still appear in content manager - Useful for sensitive information - Auto-expires after session

When to Use: - Confidential business data - Personal information - Sensitive queries - One-time questions - Testing prompts

docs.title: Viewing Message History
docs.text:
Conversation Flow: 

User: "Explain machine learning"
AI: [Detailed explanation]

User: "Give me a practical example"
AI: [Example provided]

User: "How would I apply this to customer segmentation?"
AI: [Application guidance]

Features: - Scroll up to see previous messages - Context maintained across messages - Multi-turn conversations - Follow-up questions understood

docs.title: Exporting Conversations
docs.text:
To Export:

  1. Click More Options (⋯)
  2. Select "Export"
  3. Choose format:
  4. Text (.txt)
  5. PDF (.pdf)
  6. Markdown (.md)
  7. Download file

Use Cases: - Save important conversations - Share with team members - Create documentation - Archive research - Reference later

docs.title: Sharing Conversations
docs.text:
To Share:

  1. Click More Options (⋯)
  2. Select "Share"
  3. Choose sharing method:
  4. Generate link
  5. Share with team members
  6. Email conversation
  7. Set permissions (view only, edit, etc.)

Sharing Options: - Public link (anyone with link) - Team members only - Specific users - Password-protected

docs.title: Real-Time Search
docs.text:
Enable Web Search:

  1. Click More Options (⋯)
  2. Toggle "Real Time Search" ON
  3. AI now has access to current web information

When to Use: - Current events - Latest news - Recent product releases - Up-to-date statistics - Live data

Example: 

Without Real-Time Search:
"What's the weather today?" → AI can't access current weather

With Real-Time Search:
"What's the weather today in New York?" → AI fetches live weather data

Credit Usage

Real-Time Search may consume credits. Check your plan for details.

docs.title: Multi-Turn Conversations
docs.text:
Building Context:

Turn 1: "I'm building a SaaS product for project management"
AI: [Acknowledges and asks clarifying questions]

Turn 2: "Target audience is small businesses, 10-50 employees"
AI: [Provides relevant advice]

Turn 3: "What pricing model would work best?"
AI: [Suggests pricing based on context]

Turn 4: "Create a pricing table with 3 tiers"
AI: [Generates table with context of small business focus]

Why It Works: - AI remembers previous context - Builds on earlier information - More accurate responses - Natural conversation flow

docs.title: Combining Features
docs.text:
Example Workflow:

  1. Start with Prompt Library
  2. Select "Technical & Knowledge" prompt

  3. Modify for your specific need

  4. Enable Brand Voice

  5. Select your company

  6. AI adapts tone

  7. Upload Supporting File

  8. Add relevant document

  9. Provide context

  10. Enable Real-Time Search (if needed)

  11. Get current information

  12. Supplement with latest data

  13. Export Final Result

  14. Save conversation
  15. Share with team

docs.title: Switching Models Mid-Conversation
docs.text:
To Compare Responses:

  1. Ask a question with Provider A (e.g., OpenAI)
  2. Get response
  3. Switch to Provider B (e.g., Anthropic)
  4. Ask the same question
  5. Compare answers

Use When: - Need different perspectives - Verify information - Choose best output - Test different provider strengths

Example Comparison: 

Same question to multiple providers:

OpenAI: Technical, comprehensive answer
Anthropic: Nuanced, analytical approach
Google: Multimodal response with visual context
Perplexity: Research-backed with citations
DeepSeek: Code-focused technical solution

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Problem: AI Not Responding - Cause: Network issue or model overloaded - Solution: Refresh page, try different model

Problem: Response Quality Poor - Cause: Vague prompt or model not suited for task - Solution: Be more specific in prompt, try different provider or higher-tier model

Problem: Conversation Lost Context - Cause: Too many turns or model limitation - Solution: Summarize previous context in next message

Problem: File Upload Failed - Cause: File too large or unsupported format - Solution: Compress file, convert to supported format

Problem: Credits Running Low - Cause: Using credit-consuming models/features - Solution: Switch to unlimited credit models, upgrade plan

docs.title: Getting Started with IQ Bot
docs.text: Welcome to IQ Bot! This guide will walk you through creating and deploying your first AI-powered mini-site that consolidates multiple business functions into one unified interface.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • Active iQuivity Account - Sign up at iquivity.ai
  • AI Bot Created - You'll need an AI Bot to associate with your IQ Bot
  • Content Ready - Websites, calendars, videos, or documents you want to include
  • Appropriate Permissions - Required to create and configure IQ Bots

Create AI Bot First

IQ Bot requires an underlying AI chatbot. If you haven't created one yet, see the AI Bot Creation Guide.

docs.text:
Creating an IQ Bot involves five simple steps:

Step 1: Access IQ Bot Dashboard
        ↓

Step 5: Activate and Share

docs.title: Common Issues and Solutions
docs.text:
Issue: "No AI Bot available in dropdown" 

Cause: No AI Bot created yet
Solution:
1. Navigate to AI Bot section
2. Create new AI Bot
3. Train it on your data
4. Return to IQ Bot creation
5. Select your AI Bot from dropdown

Issue: Tab not displaying content 

Cause: Incorrect embed code or URL
Solution:
1. Verify URL is accessible
2. Check for typos
3. Try "Link" instead of "Embed"
4. Test URL in browser first
5. Check X-Frame-Options on external site

Issue: QR code not generating 

Cause: Bot not saved yet
Solution:
1. Save IQ Bot first
2. QR code generates automatically
3. Access from Share menu
4. Download from Inactive/Active bot card

Issue: Can't reorder tabs 

Cause: Not using drag handle
Solution:
1. Click ⋮⋮ drag handle on left of tab
2. Drag up or down
3. Release when in desired position
4. Save changes

Issue: Changes not reflecting 

Cause: Cache or not saved
Solution:
1. Ensure you clicked Save
2. Hard refresh browser (Ctrl+Shift+R)
3. Clear browser cache
4. Try incognito/private mode
5. Check if bot is Active

Issue: Analytics showing zero 

Cause: Bot is inactive or no visits yet
Solution:
1. Activate bot
2. Visit URL to test
3. Wait 1-2 hours for data processing
4. Check if tracking is enabled
5. Verify bot is publicly accessible

docs.title: What is IQ Bot?
docs.text:
IQ Bot is an AI-powered mini-site that consolidates multiple business functions within a single URL-accessible interface, fundamentally transforming how users interact with business services by eliminating navigation between separate systems.

Unified Engagement Platform

IQ Bot presents websites, calendars, videos, documents, video calls, and AI chat in one seamless interface - accessed through a single URL or QR code.

docs.title: Fragmented Digital Experience
docs.text:
Current Challenge:

Existing web engagement systems lead to static content and fragmented user experiences. Users must navigate multiple disparate systems for different actions:

Traditional Approach (High Friction):
├─ Visit website for information
├─ Navigate to separate chat system
├─ Open calendar tool for scheduling
├─ Switch to video conferencing platform
├─ Access document portal separately
└─ Use different system for purchasing

Impact of Fragmentation: - Creates friction at every step - Multiple abandonment opportunities - Major cause of funnel drop-off - Lost conversions and revenue - Poor user experience

IQ Bot Solution:

IQ Bot Approach (Zero Friction):
┌────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  Single URL: iquivity.net/iqbot/name   │
├────────────────────────────────────────┤
│  ┌──────────────────────────────────┐  │
│  │ [Welcome] [Chat] [Calendar]      │  │
│  │ [Video] [Docs] [Buy Now]         │  │
│  ├──────────────────────────────────┤  │
│  │                                  │  │
│  │  All functions in one place      │  │
│  │  Unified interface               │  │
│  │  Shared context                  │  │
│  │  AI assistant always available   │  │
│  │                                  │  │
│  └──────────────────────────────────┘  │
└────────────────────────────────────────┘

Result: - Enhanced customer engagement - Reduced friction and abandonment - Higher conversion rates - Increased revenues - Superior user experience

docs.title: 1. AI Chatbot Foundation
docs.text:
Intelligent Assistant:

An AI chatbot trained on business data underlies the IQ Bot, available at any time to answer questions.

AI Chatbot Features: - Trained on websites, documents, raw text, and Q&A - Answers questions based on your business data - Human agent transfer capability (SMS alert) - Available across all tabs

Training Process:

Data Sources → Chunking → Vector Embeddings → Vector Database
                                                    ↓
User Question → Retrieval → Context + Question → AI Model → Answer

Technology: 1. Data Chunking - Breaking content into manageable pieces 2. Vector Embeddings - Converting text to AI-understandable format 3. Vector Database - Storing indexed knowledge 4. Retrieval - Finding relevant information 5. AI Generation - Creating accurate answers

docs.title: 1. Enter Your Image Prompt
docs.text:
Describe the image you want in detail. The more specific you are, the better the results.

Example Prompts:

Good Prompt:
"A futuristic city skyline at sunset, cyberpunk style, neon lights
reflecting on wet streets, flying cars in the background, high detail,
cinematic lighting, 4K quality, trending on artstation"

Basic Prompt:
"A city at sunset"

Prompt Writing Tips

Include these elements for best results:

  • Subject - What is the main focus?
  • Style - Photorealistic, artistic, cartoon, etc.
  • Details - Colors, lighting, atmosphere
  • Quality - High detail, 4K, professional
  • References - "Like a movie poster", "trending on artstation"

docs.title: 2. Configure Image Settings
docs.text:
Style Presets 🎨

Choose from various artistic styles:

  • Photorealistic - Looks like a real photograph
  • Digital Art - Modern digital illustration style
  • Oil Painting - Classic painted appearance
  • Watercolor - Soft, flowing watercolor effect
  • Cartoon - Animated, illustrated style
  • Anime - Japanese animation style
  • 3D Render - Computer-generated 3D look
  • Pencil Sketch - Hand-drawn sketch appearance
  • Abstract - Non-representational art
  • Vintage - Retro, aged appearance
  • Minimalist - Simple, clean design
  • Cyberpunk - Futuristic, neon aesthetic

Aspect Ratio 📐

Select the dimensions that fit your needs:

Ratio Dimensions Best For Square (1:1) 1024×1024 Social media, profile images Portrait (9:16) 768×1344 Stories, vertical content Portrait (2:3) 896×1344 Posters, prints Landscape (16:9) 1344×768 Presentations, headers Landscape (3:2) 1344×896 Photography, prints Widescreen (21:9) 1536×640 Banners, cover photos Custom Your choice Specific requirements

Resolution Quality ✨

  • Standard (512×512) - Fast generation, good for previews
  • High (1024×1024) - Balanced quality and speed
  • Ultra (2048×2048) - Maximum detail, longer generation time

Resolution Impact

Higher resolutions consume more credits and take longer to generate. Start with Standard for testing, then use Ultra for final output.

Number of Images

Generate multiple variations at once (1-4 images per request):

  • See different interpretations
  • Choose the best result
  • A/B test variations
  • Save time on iterations

docs.title: 3. Advanced Options
docs.text:
Negative Prompt 🚫

Specify what you DON'T want in the image:

Example Negative Prompt:
"blurry, low quality, deformed, ugly, bad anatomy, watermark,
text, signature, out of frame, extra fingers"

Seed Value 🎲

  • Use a specific number for reproducible results
  • Same seed + same prompt = same image
  • Leave blank for random generation
  • Share seeds to replicate results

Guidance Scale 🎯

Control how closely AI follows your prompt (1-20):

Low (1-5)     ◄──────────●──────► High (15-20)
     Creative interpretation      Strict adherence
  • Low (1-7) - More creative freedom, unexpected results
  • Medium (7-12) - Balanced approach (recommended)
  • High (12-20) - Strict following of prompt details

Steps 🔄

Number of refinement iterations (20-150):

  • Quick (20-30) - Fast, good for testing
  • Standard (30-50) - Balanced quality
  • Detailed (50-100) - Higher quality
  • Ultra (100-150) - Maximum refinement

Generation Time

More steps = better quality but longer wait time and higher credit cost

docs.title: Prompt Engineering
docs.text:
Structure Your Prompts

[Subject] + [Style] + [Details] + [Lighting] + [Quality] + [Artist Reference]

Example:
"Portrait of a woman" (subject)
+ "oil painting style" (style)
+ "wearing red dress, elegant pose" (details)
+ "soft natural lighting from window" (lighting)
+ "high detail, masterpiece" (quality)
+ "in the style of Rembrandt" (reference)

Weight Keywords ⚖️

Emphasize important elements: 

"(((beautiful landscape))), mountains, lake, (highly detailed:1.5)"

() = slight emphasis
(()) = medium emphasis
((( ))) = strong emphasis
(keyword:1.5) = 1.5x weight

docs.title: Do's ✅
docs.text:

  • Specify Style - Always mention the artistic style you want
  • Use References - Mention artists, art styles, or platforms (e.g., "Artstation")

  • Save Good Prompts - Keep a library of successful prompts

docs.title: Don'ts ❌
docs.text:
• Don't Be Vague - "A nice picture" won't give good results
  • Avoid Conflicting Descriptions - Don't mix incompatible styles
  • Don't Over-Complicate - Too many details can confuse the AI
  • Don't Expect Perfection - AI has limitations, may need iterations
  • Don't Generate Copyrighted Content - Respect intellectual property

Content Policy

docs.title: AI Writer
docs.text: The AI Writer is your intelligent writing assistant, capable of creating diverse content types for any purpose.

docs.title: 1. Select a Template
docs.text:
Navigate to Dashboard → AI Writer and choose from organized categories:

Content Categories

  • Blog Posts & Articles - Long-form content for websites and publications
  • Social Media Content - Posts for Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook
  • Marketing Copy - Ads, landing pages, email campaigns
  • Product Descriptions - E-commerce content that sells
  • Email Templates - Professional and marketing emails
  • SEO Content - Keyword-optimized articles and meta content
  • Creative Writing - Stories, scripts, poetry, song lyrics

Template Recommendations

Not sure which template to use? Click the "Recommend" button and answer a few questions about your content goals for personalized suggestions.

docs.title: 2. Enter Your Prompt
docs.text:
Provide a clear, detailed description of what you want to create.

Example Prompts:

Good Prompt:
"Write a professional blog post about the benefits of AI in healthcare,
1000 words, targeting medical professionals, including 3 real-world
examples and statistics"

Bad Prompt:
"Write about healthcare"

Be Specific

The more detailed your prompt, the better your results. Include information about:

  • Target audience
  • Desired length
  • Tone and style
  • Key points to cover
  • Any specific requirements

docs.title: 3. Customize Settings
docs.text:
Fine-tune your content generation with these options:

Tone Settings - Professional - Formal business communication - Casual - Relaxed, conversational style - Friendly - Warm and approachable - Formal - Academic or official documents - Creative - Unique and imaginative - Persuasive - Convincing sales copy - Informative - Educational and explanatory

Language Options - Select from 50+ languages - Multi-language content generation - Automatic translation available

Length Control - Short - 100-300 words - Medium - 300-800 words - Long - 800-2000 words - Custom - Specify exact word count

Creativity Level 

Conservative ◄──────●────► Highly Creative
                 (Slider)

  • Low - Factual, predictable, safe
  • Medium - Balanced creativity and reliability
  • High - Unique, imaginative, experimental

Target Audience - Specify who will read this content - Helps AI adjust vocabulary and complexity - Examples: executives, students, general public, experts

docs.title: 4. Generate Content
docs.text:
1. Review your settings
  2. Click "Generate" button
  3. Wait for AI processing (typically 5-30 seconds)
  4. Content appears in the editor

Generation Time

  • Short content: 5-10 seconds
  • Medium content: 10-20 seconds
  • Long content: 20-30 seconds

Premium plans have priority processing for faster results.

docs.title: 5. Edit & Refine
docs.text:

Improve ✨ - Enhance existing text - Better word choice and flow - Grammar and style corrections - Click on any paragraph and select "Improve"

Expand 📝 - Add more details to selected text - Elaborate on ideas - Reach target word count - Maintains consistent tone

Shorten ✂️ - Condense verbose content - Keep key information - Meet strict word limits - Preserve meaning

Rewrite 🔄 - Generate alternative versions - Different perspective or angle - Change tone or style - Get multiple variations

Continue Writing ➡️ - AI continues from where you left off - Maintains context and flow - Overcome writer's block - Extend your content naturally

Built-in Editor Features - Rich text formatting - Spell check and grammar - Word count tracker - Reading time estimate - Plagiarism checker (Premium plans)

docs.title: 6. Save & Export
docs.text:
Save Options - Save to Workspace - Keep in your iQuivity account - Create Version - Save multiple versions - Auto-save - Enabled by default every 30 seconds

Use ⌘/Ctrl + E to quickly export your document. Choose your format and download instantly!

docs.title: 2FA Setup Steps
docs.text:
Step 1: Install Authenticator App

Download and install one of these authenticator apps: - Google Authenticator (iOS, Android) - Microsoft Authenticator (iOS, Android) - Authy (iOS, Android, Desktop) - 1Password - LastPass Authenticator

Step 2: Scan QR Code

Open your authenticator app and scan the QR code displayed on the page.

Alternative: Manual Entry If you can't scan the QR code: 1. Click the copy icon next to the manual key 2. Open your authenticator app 3. Choose "Enter key manually" 4. Paste the key (e.g., NHCIJFTSAR5WSMER) 5. Save the entry

Step 3: Enter Verification Code

  1. Your authenticator app will display a 6-digit code
  2. Enter this code on the 2FA setup page
  3. Click Enable 2FA
  4. 2FA is now activated!

2FA Activated

Once enabled, you'll need to enter a code from your authenticator app every time you log in (unless you check "Trust this device").

docs.title: Disabling 2FA
docs.text:
If you need to disable 2FA:

  1. Click your profile icon → 2-Factor Auth.
  2. On the My Account page, under Security section, click Deactivate 2FA
  3. Enter your current password
  4. Enter current 2FA code from authenticator app
  5. Confirm deactivation

Security Warning

Disabling 2FA makes your account less secure. Only disable if absolutely necessary.

docs.title: Script Writing Guidelines
docs.text:
Script Best Practices:

Opening (0-5 seconds): 

Hook Examples:
- "Hey everyone! You won't believe this..."
- "I've been testing this for 2 weeks and..."
- "This changed everything for me..."
- "Let me show you something amazing..."
- "I need to tell you about this..."

Body (5-50 seconds): 

Structure:
├── Introduce topic/product
├── Share 2-3 key benefits
├── Personal experience/opinion
├── Demonstrate or explain features
└── Address common questions

Closing (Last 5-10 seconds): 

Call-to-Action Examples:
- "Check the link in my description!"
- "Let me know what you think in the comments!"
- "Get yours today - link below!"
- "Follow for more reviews like this!"
- "Don't forget to subscribe!"

Script Tips: - ✅ Write conversationally (how people speak) - ✅ Use contractions (I'm, you're, it's) - ✅ Include pauses with ellipses (...) - ✅ Break into short sentences - ✅ Add emphasis with capitalization sparingly - ✅ Natural speech patterns (um, like, you know) - ❌ Avoid overly formal language - ❌ Don't write very long sentences - ❌ Avoid complicated vocabulary

Word count: ~30-40 words

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Poor Lip Sync: - Cause: Complex script, fast speech, punctuation issues - Solution: - Simplify script structure - Add natural pauses (...) - Use shorter sentences - Adjust voice speed to "Slow" - Regenerate video

Unnatural Voice: - Cause: Wrong accent selection, unnatural phrasing, speed issues - Solution: - Select appropriate accent - Write more conversationally - Adjust speed and pitch - Use contractions (I'm, you're) - Add natural speech patterns

Video Generation Failed: - Cause: Script too long, special characters, connection issue - Solution: - Shorten script - Remove special characters/symbols - Check internet connection - Try different avatar - Contact support if persists

Subtitles Not Appearing: - Cause: Subtitle option not enabled, rendering issue - Solution: - Enable subtitles in settings - Regenerate video - Download with embedded subtitles - Check subtitle language matches script

docs.title: Creating Effective Product Videos
docs.text:
Content Strategy: - ✅ Start with attention-grabbing visual - ✅ Highlight main benefit in first 5 seconds - ✅ Show product in use - ✅ Include clear pricing if applicable - ✅ Strong call-to-action at end

Visual Quality: - 📷 Use high-resolution product images - 🎨 Maintain consistent brand colors - 🎬 Avoid cluttered compositions - 💫 Use smooth transitions - 🔆 Ensure good lighting in images

Script Writing: - 📝 Keep it concise and clear - 🎯 Focus on benefits, not just features - 💡 Use emotional triggers - 🔢 Include specific numbers/stats - ❗ Create sense of urgency

Technical Tips: - 📱 Test on mobile devices first - 🔊 Ensure video works without sound - 📏 Use platform-specific dimensions - ⚡ Optimize file size for fast loading - 🎵 Choose appropriate music tempo

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
URL Not Analyzing: - Cause: Invalid URL, unsupported platform, page blocked - Solution: - Verify URL is correct and accessible - Check if platform is supported - Try manual upload method - Ensure product page is public

Poor Image Quality: - Cause: Low-resolution source images, compressed images - Solution: - Use manual upload with high-res images - Contact seller for better images - Upscale images using AI tools first - Choose template that works with available quality

Script Doesn't Match Product: - Cause: AI misunderstood product features, incomplete data - Solution: - Manually edit script in Step 3 - Add more product details in Step 2 - Regenerate script with different tone - Write custom script manually

Video Rendering Failed: - Cause: Processing error, timeout, invalid settings - Solution: - Retry rendering - Check internet connection - Reduce video duration/resolution - Contact support if persists

Wrong Aspect Ratio: - Cause: Incorrect platform selection in Step 4 - Solution: - Go back to Step 4 - Select correct aspect ratio - Re-render video - Download multiple ratios for flexibility

docs.title: AI Influencer - AI Viral Clips
docs.text: Automatically extract engaging short clips from long-form video content for social media.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
AI Viral Clips uses artificial intelligence to analyze long videos and automatically identify the most engaging moments. Transform podcasts, webinars, interviews, and other long-form content into bite-sized viral clips perfect for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and other short-form platforms.

AI-Powered Clip Detection

Advanced AI analyzes your video content to identify viral-worthy moments, emotional peaks, key quotes, and engaging segments automatically.

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Video Upload Failed: - Cause: File too large, unsupported format, connection issue - Solution: - Compress video to under 2GB - Convert to MP4 format - Check internet connection - Use URL upload instead - Try splitting into smaller segments

Poor Clip Quality: - Cause: Low-resolution source, compression artifacts - Solution: - Use higher quality source video - Upload original files (not compressed) - Select higher quality export settings - Avoid multiple re-encodes

No Clips Generated: - Cause: Video too short, poor audio, no speech detected - Solution: - Ensure video is at least 5 minutes - Check audio track exists and is audible - Verify language selection is correct - Test with different video - Contact support with video details

Subtitles Inaccurate: - Cause: Poor audio quality, accents, background noise, wrong language - Solution: - Verify correct language selected - Use video with clearer audio - Manually edit subtitles after generation - Remove background music/noise from source - Consider professional audio cleanup

Processing Taking Too Long: - Cause: Long video, high clip count, server load - Solution: - Reduce number of clips requested - Process during off-peak hours - Split video into segments - Upgrade to priority processing - Check account tier limits

docs.text:
The Settings page allows you to configure your Marketing Bot integrations for both Telegram and WhatsApp. Set up API tokens, configure webhooks, and manage environment settings for seamless automated messaging.

Secure Configuration

Configuration Steps:

  1. Obtain Telegram Bot Token: 

    1. Open Telegram and search for @BotFather
2. Send /newbot command
3. Follow prompts to create bot:
   - Enter bot name (e.g., "My Marketing Bot")
   - Enter username (must end in 'bot', e.g., "my_marketing_bot")
4. BotFather provides API token
5. Copy the token (format: 1234567890:ABCdefGHIjklMNOpqrsTUVwxyz)

  2. Configure in Settings: 

    1. Navigate to Marketing Bot Settings
2. Locate "Marketing Bot Telegram" section
3. Paste token in "Access Token" field
4. Click "Save"
5. Verify connection status

Token Security: - Token is masked as ********** for security - Click "Show" to reveal token temporarily - Click "Regenerate" to create new token from BotFather - Never share your bot token publicly

3. WhatsApp Phone:

   - Format: +[country code][number]
   - Example: +12035550101

4. WhatsApp Sandbox Phone:

The Calendar view provides a comprehensive scheduling interface where you can visualize, plan, and manage your social media posts across all connected platforms. Schedule content days, weeks, or months in advance with an intuitive drag-and-drop interface.

Planning Phase: - 📋 Define clear, measurable goals - 🎯 Understand target audience deeply - 📅 Plan content calendar in advance - 💰 Allocate budget realistically - 🤝 Align team roles and responsibilities

docs.title: Tips & Best Practices
docs.text: Maximize your productivity and get the best results from iQuivity AI with these proven tips and best practices.

docs.title: Writing Effective Prompts
docs.text: The quality of AI output depends heavily on your prompts.

docs.title: Prompt Formula
docs.text:
Context + Task + Format + Constraints + Examples = Perfect Prompt

Example:

❌ Bad Prompt: 

"Write about marketing"

✅ Good Prompt: 

"As a B2B SaaS marketing expert, write a 500-word blog post about
email marketing automation for small business owners. Use a friendly
but professional tone. Include 3 specific benefits with real-world
examples. Target audience: non-technical business owners with limited
marketing experience."

docs.title: Prompt Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Be Specific - State exactly what you want - Include details about length, tone, audience - Specify format and structure

2. Provide Context - Who is the audience? - What is the purpose? - Where will this be used?

3. Set Constraints - Word count or length limits - Tone and style requirements - What to include/exclude - Format requirements

4. Use Examples - Show the style you want - Reference similar content - Describe the desired outcome

5. Iterate - Start with base prompt - Refine based on results - Save successful prompts

docs.title: Optimizing Content Quality
docs.text:
Review and Edit - Never use AI content without review - Always fact-check information - Add your personal touch - Verify accuracy

Use the Right Tone 

Professional: Business documents, proposals, reports
Casual: Social media, blog posts, emails
Friendly: Customer communications, welcome messages
Formal: Legal documents, academic writing
Creative: Marketing copy, storytelling

Specify Your Audience - General public - Industry professionals - Technical experts - Beginners - Executives - Students

Leverage Templates - Start with proven templates - Customize for your needs - Create custom templates for reuse - Share best templates with team

docs.title: Save Credits Strategically
docs.text:
1. Use Appropriate Settings - Don't use "long" if "medium" suffices - Start with standard resolution for images - Use lower creativity for straightforward content

2. Batch Similar Tasks - Generate multiple variations at once - More efficient than individual requests - Use bulk operations when available

3. Refine Prompts First - Test with short outputs first - Perfect your prompt before full generation - Use test mode if available

4. Use Improve Features Wisely - Edit specific sections instead of regenerating all - Use "Improve" on paragraphs vs entire document - Selective enhancements save credits

5. Leverage Templates - Templates are optimized for efficiency - Pre-tested prompts use fewer credits - Consistent results with less trial and error

docs.title: Credit Usage Guidelines
docs.text:
Cost-Effective Operations: 

✅ Use templates (optimized prompts)
✅ Edit and improve sections (vs full regeneration)
✅ Standard image resolution for drafts
✅ Shorter content for testing
✅ Batch operations

Credit-Intensive Operations: 

⚠️  Ultra-high resolution images
⚠️  Long-form video generation
⚠️  Multiple variations without batching
⚠️  Regenerating entire documents
⚠️  Maximum creativity settings

Example Support Email:

Plan: Professional

Issue:
My chatbot (ID: bot_abc123) is not responding when
embedded on my website (https://example.com). The
widget appears but clicking it does nothing.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Visit https://example.com
2. Click chat widget in bottom-right

- Cleared browser cache
- Tested in Chrome and Firefox

docs.title: Troubleshooting Common Issues
docs.text: Solutions to common problems and issues you may encounter while using iQuivity AI.

docs.title: Issue: Content Generation Fails
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Error message when generating content - Request times out - No response received

Common Causes & Solutions:

1. Insufficient Credits

Check your credit balance: 

Dashboard → Usage Statistics → Credits Remaining

Solution: - Upgrade your plan - Purchase additional credits - Wait for monthly credit reset

2. Network/Connectivity Issues

Solution: - Check your internet connection - Try refreshing the page - Clear browser cache - Try a different browser

3. Prompt Too Complex

Solution: - Simplify your prompt - Break into smaller requests - Reduce word count requirement - Lower creativity setting

4. Service Temporarily Down

Solution: - Check status page: https://status.iquivity.ai - Wait a few minutes and retry - Contact support if persistent

docs.title: Issue: Poor Quality Output
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Generated content doesn't match expectations - Off-topic or irrelevant content - Grammatical errors - Incomplete responses

Solutions:

1. Improve Your Prompt

❌ Vague: 

"Write about marketing"

✅ Specific: 

"Write a 500-word blog post about email marketing best practices
for small businesses, using a friendly and professional tone,
including 3 actionable tips with examples."

2. Adjust Settings - Change tone (professional, casual, friendly) - Modify creativity level - Specify target audience - Set appropriate length

3. Use Templates - Browse template library - Choose relevant template - Provides better structure

4. Iterate and Refine - Generate initial version - Use "Improve" feature - Regenerate specific sections - Add more context if needed

docs.title: Issue: Generation Takes Too Long
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Processing for more than 2 minutes - Page appears stuck - No progress indication

Solutions:

1. Reduce Complexity - Shorten requested length - Use lower quality settings (for images) - Simplify requirements

2. Check Plan Limits - Free/Starter plans may have slower processing - Upgrade to Professional for priority processing - Enterprise gets fastest processing

3. Try During Off-Peak Hours - High traffic times may be slower - Try early morning or late evening

4. Clear and Retry - Cancel current request - Start fresh request - Sometimes resolves stuck requests

docs.title: Issue: Files Won't Upload
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Upload fails with error - Progress bar stuck - "Upload failed" message

Common Causes & Solutions:

1. File Too Large

Check file size limits: - Free: 25 MB max - Starter: 100 MB max - Professional: 500 MB max - Enterprise: 2 GB max

Solution: - Compress file - Split into smaller files - Upgrade plan for larger limits

2. Unsupported Format

Solution: - Convert to supported format - Check file extension - Contact support for format questions

3. Storage Full

Solution: 

Settings → Storage → View Usage
- Delete old files - Empty trash - Upgrade storage plan

4. Browser Issues

Solution: - Clear browser cache and cookies - Try different browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) - Disable browser extensions - Update browser to latest version

5. Network Issues

Solution: - Check internet connection - Try on different network - Wait and retry during better connection - Use wired connection if on WiFi

docs.title: Issue: Uploaded Files Not Appearing
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Upload completes successfully - File doesn't show in file list - Can't find uploaded file

Solutions:

1. Refresh the Page - Press F5 or Cmd+R - Hard refresh: Ctrl+Shift+R (Cmd+Shift+R on Mac)

2. Check Filters - Clear all active filters - Check "All Files" view - Search by filename

3. Check Folder Location - Verify upload destination folder - Check if in different folder

4. Processing Delay - Large files may take time to process - Check back in a few minutes - Receive email when complete

docs.title: Issue: Chatbot Not Responding
docs.text:
Symptoms: - No response to messages - "Chatbot unavailable" error - Loading indicator stuck

Solutions:

1. Check Chatbot Status 

Dashboard → Chatbots → [Your Chatbot] → Settings
- Verify chatbot is "Active" - Check operating hours - Ensure not paused

2. Verify Embed Code

For Website Integration: - Check embed code is correct - Verify placed before </body> tag - Check for JavaScript errors (browser console) - Ensure chatbot ID is correct

3. Test in Dashboard - Go to chatbot testing interface - Test with sample questions - If works there, issue is with deployment

4. Check Training Data - Verify chatbot has training data - Re-index training content - Add more training if limited

5. Clear Browser Data - Clear cache and cookies - Try incognito/private mode - Test in different browser

docs.title: Issue: Chatbot Gives Wrong Answers
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Incorrect or irrelevant responses - Out-of-date information - Doesn't understand questions

Solutions:

1. Review Training Data - Check if relevant information exists - Update outdated content - Add missing information - Remove conflicting data

2. Add Question Variations - Include alternative phrasings - Add synonyms - Cover common variations

3. Improve Training Quality - Use clear, well-structured content - Avoid duplicate information - Organize by topic - Use consistent terminology

4. Adjust Confidence Threshold 

Chatbot Settings → Behavior → Confidence Threshold
- Increase threshold for more accuracy - May trigger more fallbacks - Find balance for your use case

5. Test and Iterate - Test with real user questions - Review unanswered queries - Continuously improve training

docs.title: Issue: Chatbot Widget Not Displaying
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Chat widget doesn't appear on website - Only shows briefly then disappears - Appears but non-functional

Solutions:

1. Verify Installation 

<!-- Check this code is on your website -->
<script src="https://iquivity.ai/chatbot-embed.js"></script>
<script>
  ChatBot.init({
    chatbotId: 'your-chatbot-id' // Verify ID is correct
  });
</script>

2. Check for Conflicts - Other chat widgets may conflict - Disable other scripts temporarily - Check browser console for errors

3. Verify Domain - Some chatbots may be domain-restricted - Check allowed domains in settings - Add your domain if needed

4. Check CSS Conflicts - Your site CSS may hide widget - Check z-index settings - Inspect element in browser dev tools

5. Test Different Browsers - May be browser-specific issue - Test Chrome, Firefox, Safari - Check mobile browsers

docs.title: Issue: Can't Log In
docs.text:
Symptoms: - "Invalid email or password" error - Account locked message - Can't receive verification code

Solutions:

1. Verify Credentials - Check email address is correct - Verify caps lock is off - Try copying/pasting password - Check for extra spaces

2. Reset Password 

Login Page → "Forgot Password?"
- Enter registered email - Check inbox (and spam folder) - Follow reset link - Create new password

3. 2FA Issues - Verify code from authenticator app - Ensure device time is synced - Use backup code if available - Disable and re-enable 2FA if needed

4. Account Locked - After multiple failed attempts - Wait 30 minutes - Contact support@iquivity.ai

5. Email Not Verified - Check for verification email - Resend verification email - Check spam/junk folder - Add noreply@iquivity.ai to contacts

docs.title: Issue: Missing Features/Content
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Features you had access to are gone - Can't see previously created content - Missing team members or chatbots

Possible Causes:

1. Plan Downgrade - Check current plan: Settings → Billing - Some features require higher plans - Upgrade to restore access

2. Subscription Expired - Check billing status - Update payment method - Renew subscription

3. Wrong Account - May be logged into different account - Check email address in profile - Switch accounts if multiple

4. Accidental Deletion - Check trash folder - Items kept for 30 days - Restore from trash

5. Team Settings Changed - For team accounts, permissions may have changed - Contact team admin - Verify your role and permissions

docs.title: Issue: Payment Failed
docs.text:
Symptoms: - "Payment declined" error - Unable to upgrade plan - Subscription cancelled

Solutions:

1. Verify Payment Method 

Settings → Billing → Payment Methods
- Check card is not expired - Verify billing address is correct - Ensure sufficient funds - Update payment information

2. Try Different Payment Method - Add new credit card - Try PayPal - Contact bank about international transactions

3. Contact Support - If payment should have worked - Provide transaction details - Alternative payment arrangements

docs.title: Issue: Incorrect Charges
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Unexpected charge - Wrong amount billed - Charged after cancellation

Solutions:

1. Review Invoice 

Settings → Billing → Invoice History
- Check invoice details - Verify services purchased - Look for add-ons or overages

2. Check Subscription Status - Verify plan and billing cycle - Check if annual vs monthly - Review any mid-cycle changes

3. Contact Billing Support - Email: billing@iquivity.ai - Include invoice number - Describe discrepancy - Request review

docs.title: Issue: Slow Performance
docs.text:
Symptoms: - Pages load slowly - Actions take long to complete - Interface feels sluggish

Solutions:

1. Browser Optimization - Clear cache and cookies - Close unnecessary tabs - Update browser to latest version - Try different browser

2. Internet Connection - Test connection speed - Try wired connection - Restart router - Contact ISP if persistent

3. Disable Extensions - Some extensions slow performance - Try incognito/private mode - Disable extensions one by one

4. Check System Resources - Close other applications - Check CPU/RAM usage - Restart computer if needed

docs.title: Issue: API Requests Failing
docs.text:
Symptoms: - 401 Unauthorized error - 429 Rate Limit error - 500 Server error

Solutions:

1. 401 Unauthorized 

{
  "error": {
    "code": "invalid_api_key"
  }
}

Fix: - Verify API key is correct - Check Authorization header format - Regenerate API key if needed - Ensure key hasn't been deleted

2. 429 Rate Limit 

{
  "error": {
    "code": "rate_limit_exceeded"
  }
}

Fix: - Wait for rate limit to reset - Implement exponential backoff - Check rate limit headers - Upgrade plan for higher limits - Contact support for custom limits

3. 500 Server Error

Fix: - Check status page - Retry request after delay - Contact support if persistent - Implement retry logic
